intro: Pluchia curiosa, commonly known as the curious pluchia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pluchia curiosa is often found in moist, sunny habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
